summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview report summarizing an interview conducted on August 19, 2019, with a Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) guard, Tova Noel, regarding her duties and observations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, specifically concerning the housing and monitoring of Jeffrey Epstein prior to his death. The document details standard procedures and the guard's perspective on Epstein's treatment.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.role: Senior Officer of Special Housing (SOS) / 2nd officer of the SHU, BOP Guard
persons.context: A Federal Bureau of Prisons guard interviewed about her duties, procedures for conducting rounds and counts at the MCC's Special Housing Unit (SHU), and her knowledge of Jeffrey Epstein's status as a high-profile prisoner.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The high-profile prisoner housed in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) whose death is the subject of the surrounding investigation. The guard states he was treated the same as other prisoners.

connections.description: Noel was a guard responsible for monitoring Epstein in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Interview of BOP Guard Tova Noel
events.description: FBI and OIG agents interview Federal Bureau of Prisons guard Tova Noel regarding procedures and her observations related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration at the MCC.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Prior Suicide Attempt
events.description: The document references Epstein being on a 'hot list' due to a prior suicide attempt, which the guard was aware of.

events.title: Epstein Without a Cellmate
events.description: The day prior to Epstein's death, guard Tova Noel was aware that Epstein was without a cellmate and notified other guards relieving her shift about this.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
keyFacts: BOP guard Tova Noel described standard procedures for conducting 'rounds' and 'counts' in the Special Housing Unit, noting times are often approximated at the end of a shift.
Noel stated she was aware Jeffrey Epstein was a high-profile prisoner but treated him the same as other inmates.
Noel was aware of Epstein's prior suicide attempt and that he was on a 'hot list' for monitoring.
On the day prior to Epstein's death, Noel was aware Epstein was without a cellmate and notified relieving guards of this situation.
